title: When Riot gives you a 14 day for defending yourself against 4 Toxic teammates
body:
for the record, this is not a joke. I got 4 man shittalked for 20 minutes and riot suspended me for it. I didn't use fowl language. I tried my best to win the game. System works great, totally. This game is great, the community/ban system is so bad it's not worth playing anyway. 

inb4 riot says their punishment system works fine.

replies.body: Care to post your chat logs?

Well the thing here is, literally anything can be toxic. I can say "Fuck off vayne" then mute them, and get chat restricted for it. It's happened before. The system is garbage and needs to be addressed. It's one of those things where it depends on the players your in the game with. People look at things differently, aka, people are overly sensitive and just automatically go to the report option.
Saying one line, in a 30 minute game is very low impact. You would have to repeat that behavior for many games, and get reported for it in each one for the system to issue a punishment.

Why didn't you just mute them? You wouldn't have felt you needed to be toxic back to them if you just muted them.

Riot does not care who started it. Riot only cares if you were toxic or not, because it doesn't matter who started it. You have a mute button and a report button. That's your "defense" if you're being flamed/shittalked.

> [{quoted}](name=Chermorg,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=OMuscKQa,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-10-04T19:00:56.809+0000)
>
> Why didn't you just mute them? You wouldn't have felt you needed to be toxic back to them if you just muted them.
> 
> Riot does not care who started it. Riot only cares if you were toxic or not, because it doesn't matter who started it. You have a mute button and a report button. That's your "defense" if you're being flamed/shittalked.

Because its not human nature. If you hit me im going to hit you back. Why do people like you constantly put blame on the victim?

Hitting you in the face? Hardly. It's more like "throwing a tantrum because another kid in the supermarket is throwing one too".

So now everyone has to deal with two screaming toddlers instead of just the one.

> [{quoted}](name=Tosha,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=OMuscKQa,comment-id=000300000001,timestamp=2017-10-04T20:03:06.847+0000)
>
> Hitting you in the face? Hardly. It's more like "throwing a tantrum because another kid in the supermarket is throwing one too".
> 
> So now everyone has to deal with two screaming toddlers instead of just the one.

The jungler told me I was a nub for pushing the wave, so I told him to kys. You don't understand, it was me or him.

Is this sarcasm?


I bet it is, no one can be this knowingly stupid.

Definitely sarcasm.

You can tell from the last sentence, "You don't understand, it was me or him."

> [{quoted}](name=zarxus1234,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=OMuscKQa,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2017-10-04T19:15:06.450+0000)
>
> Because its not human nature. If you hit me im going to hit you back. Why do people like you constantly put blame on the victim?

It's not a fist fight, it's a shouting match.
Because this ain't close to what's going on.
I disagree. If someone tries to hit me, I do not swing back. I simply block the blows until someone steps in to resolve the situation. There is defending and then there is retaliation.

Human nature or not, we are expected to behave in a manner that does not increase the negativity or harm the experience of other players playing the game with us.

Regardless of who causes it, if the game is made less fun for others due to negativity or insults, Riot sees that as punishable.

What this translates to is if you are flamed and say, "stop flaming me dude, it hurts." You should be fine. But if you say, "hey shithead stop insulting me." Then you're going to get in trouble. People are free to express their emotions so long as they do not attack others while doing so.
If you retaliate, you're no longer a victim, you are now a combatant.
To elaborate since I'm not using a cellphone, what this is is someone talking shit to you and everyone in this restaurant unable to enjoy their conversation over the noise.

LoL is a restaurant.
You go into the restaurant.
Someone there insults you.
You insult him back.
You start to yell at each other.
Both of you get kicked out, cause you are both annoying as fuck.

Yes, i actually think this is human nature and its called common sense.
Post your chat logs. Complete and unedited ofc.

You clearly had to have done something for the system to have punished you, and you've clearly had issues in the past. If you were as innocent as you claim, it wouldn't just jump to a 14 day ban. Furthermore, the system looks for language when a game has been flagged by a report. If it finds offensive language that fits in with the report filed against you, it then issues a punishment. Therefore, if haven't said anything the entire game, and 4 people report you, the system won't punish you because it doesn't have evidence. But if you have said something offensive, and you get reported, it will flag you and issue punishment if you've had enough games with valid reports against you.

Other people being toxic isn't justification for being toxic yourself, if you had defended yourself as you said then you would have muted them, reported them at the end of the game, not told them you were muting/reporting them, and then moved on with your life.

What you seem to have done is counterattacked, which is still being on the offensive.
I can't trust your words. *ACTIONS SPEAK LOUDER THAN WORDS* also bring chat logs

That which can be asserted without evidence can be dismissed without evidence.

Chat logs?

I have to agree , pubgs looking better every single day, literally more viewers, more competitive, and you can actually say things without worrying about offending some pre-teen weeabo who needs a safe space.

I love how many toxic players run to the "safe space" argument. Makes me wonder if Riot created a "Toxic Pick" where you can be as toxic as you want without getting in trouble. If they would even play it since it would be a "safe space" for them.
